VHF Low Band.Description: FM Radio, Television, Amateur Radio, Public Safety, Aircraft Communication, Weather Radio.

VHF High Band.Description: Two-way radio communications, aircraft, amateur radio.

UHF Band I.Description: Wireless microphones, Public Safety, Land Mobile Radio.

Low VHF+FM.Description: A combined range covering low VHF TV channels and the FM radio band.

High VHF+216.Description: A combined range including high VHF TV channels and other services around 216 MHz.

UHF 400-500.Description: A common UHF range that includes public safety, two-way radio, and television broadcasting.

UHF 500-600.Description: A common UHF television broadcasting and wireless microphone band.

UHF 600-700.Description: A common UHF television broadcasting and wireless microphone band.

UHF 700-800.Description: A common UHF television broadcasting, cellular, and public safety band.

UHF 800-900.Description: A common UHF band used for cellular and public safety communications.

ISM-STL 900-970.Description: Industrial, Scientific, and Medical (ISM) band and Studio-to-Transmitter Link (STL) frequency ranges.

AFTRCC 1430-1540.Description: Aviation Frequency Technical Resource Committee (AFTRCC) band used for flight test telemetry.

DECT-ALL 1880-2000.Description: Digital Enhanced Cordless Telecommunications (DECT) band for cordless phones and wireless data transmission.

Cams Lower 2G-2G2.Description: Lower range of the 2 GHz band, often used for wireless video cameras and data links.

Cams Upper 2G4-2G4.Description: Upper range of the 2 GHz band, often used for wireless video cameras and data links.
